alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 2:44PM EST until January 04 at 7:09PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. .Heavy rain from the past 12 hours have caused the river to rise. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. At 26.0 feet, County roads near Sunnydale flood. At 27.0 feet, KY 919 flood at Underwood and Clifty Huff Roads near Narrows. At 28.0 feet, Trailer courts in Hartford flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 25.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM CST Tuesday was 25.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.1 feet on 06/29/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tonight.
